text:
This worries me because it does not align with any of our co-parenting commitments.
Please let me know. I doubt you would intentionally do this to make co-parenting impossible.
Message 3068 of 4024
Just making a note that you don’t bother checking OFW at all anymore.
Sent:06/08/2024 at 11:02 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/09/2024 at 06:44 AM)
Subject:Re: OFW Communications
Message 3069 of 4024
Thanks. Is there something we need to align on?
Sent:06/09/2024 at 06:45 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 06/09/2024 at 07:17 AM)
Subject:Re: OFW Communications
Message 3070 of 4024
I need to be able to check in on the health and welfare of our children.
AD and I had a particularly emotional situation over the two days you blocked all access over his B-Day and day after. You would not allow that to
happen.
That’s alarming to me and imho shows a consistent disregard for him, and working with your co-parent.
Please confirm what sort of communication plan you are going to follow for that purpose, if this is not it.
Sent:06/09/2024 at 07:28 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/09/2024 at 10:16 AM)
Subject:Re: OFW Communications
Message 3071 of 4024
We should align with counselor your communications with Adrian as it seems to be causing him distress when you connect with him as you report.
He has been great with me and when with his friends.
I will ask why he gets distressed.
Sent:06/09/2024 at 10:20 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 06/09/2024 at 10:21 AM)
Subject:Re: OFW Communications
